rule.name: ThenTryRule
rule.description: You always should place 'begin' statement after 'try', this helps to prevent errors.

rule.name: NoFunctionReturnTypeRule
rule.description: All functions should have return type specified.
rule.example: function TMainWindow.foo(x : byte); //WRONG, no return type function TMainWindow.foo(x : byte): integer; //GOOD

rule.message: Only one class in a file
rule.name: OneClassPerFileRule
rule.description: On class should be included in one file, for clarity reasons.

rule.message: Inherited method, with no additional code.
rule.name: InheritedMethodWithNoCodeRule
rule.description: Some methods that only inherits parent method behaviour are not needed (redundant).

rule.name: EmptyExceptBlockRule
rule.description: Empty 'except' block, you should catch some exceptions.
rule.example: try ( ... code ... ) except //WRONG, except statement does not catch anything end;

rule.name: EmptyFinallyBlockRule
rule.description: Avoid empty finally blocks - these can be deleted.

rule.name: EmptyInterfaceRule
rule.description: You may have forgotten to fill some interface with methods.

rule.name: TooLongMethodRule
rule.description: A method that grows too large tends to aggregate too many responsibilities. Such method inevitably become harder to understand and therefore harder to maintain. Above a specific threshold, it is strongly advised to refactor into smaller methods which focus on well-defined tasks. Those smaller methods will not only be easier to understand, but also probably easier to test.

rule.name: TooManyArgumentsRule
rule.description: Function may have too many arguments, maximum number of arguments is 6

rule.name: TooManyVariablesRule
rule.description: Function may have too many variables, maximum number of variables is 10

rule.name: NoSemiAfterOverloadRule
rule.description: You should put semicolon ';' after 'overload' keyword, at the end of method declaration.
rule.example: procedure foo1(x: integer); overload //WRONG, no ; at end procedure foo2(x: integer); overload; //GOOD

rule.message: Interface Name should comply with a naming convention
rule.name: InterfaceNameRule
rule.description: According to Object Pascal Style Guide interface name should begin with capital 'I' letter.

rule.message: Class Name should comply with a naming
rule.name: ClassNameRule
rule.description: According to Object Pascal Style Guide class name should begin with capital 'T' letter, less Exception classes, which starts with 'E'.

rule.message: Record Name should comply with a naming convention
rule.name: RecordNameRule
rule.description: According to Object Pascal Style Guide record name should begin with capital 'T' letter.

rule.message: Pointer Name should comply with a naming convention
rule.name: PointerNameRule
rule.description: Pointer name should begin with 'P' letter.

rule.message: Method Name should comply with a naming convention
rule.name: MethodNameRule
rule.description: According to Object Pascal Style Guide method name should follow Pascal Case.

rule.message: Field names should comply with a naming convention
rule.name: FieldNameRule
rule.description: According to Object Pascal Style Guide field name should begin with 'F' letter..

rule.message: Unit names should comply with a naming convention
rule.name: UnitNameRule
rule.description: According to Object Pascal Style Guide unit name should follow Pascal Case.

rule.name: CatchingGeneralExceptionRule
rule.description: You should not catch general exceptions but descendants of Exception class.
rule.example: except on e : Exception do //WRONG, catching general Exception class except on e : MyException do //GOOD, catching specific exception type

rule.name: RaisingGeneralExceptionRule
rule.description: You should not raise a general Exception class.
rule.example: raise Exception.create('blah'); //WRONG, raising general exception class raise MyException.create('blah'); //GOOD, raising specific exception

rule.name: AvoidOutParameterRule
rule.description: Avoid 'out' variable parameters. Nasty.

rule.name: IfTrueRule
rule.description: You don't need to write 'if x = true', this is redundant. Instead write 'if x'.

rule.message: Change from 'if not (x=false)' to 'if not x'
rule.name: IfNotFalseRule
rule.description: You don't need to write 'if not (x = false)', this is redundant. Instead write 'if x'.

rule.name: PublicFieldsRule
rule.description: You shouldn't make public fields. Make them private/protected and add a getter/setter methods.

rule.message: Unused method parameters should be removed
rule.name: UnusedArgumentsRule
rule.description: You should always use every passed function argument.

rule.name: NoGuidRule
rule.description: Every interface should contain unique Guid.

rule.message: You don't have to check for assignement when calling Free
rule.name: AssignedAndFreeRule
rule.description: Free() method does check if the freed variable is not nil, you don't have to do it manually.
rule.example: if Assigned(x) then x.Free; //WRONG if x <> nil then x.Free; //WRONG x.Free; //GOOD, sufficent enough

rule.name: EmptyElseStatementRule
rule.description: You should not write an empty 'else' statement.

rule.name: EmptyBeginStatementRule
rule.description: You should not write an empty 'begin' statement.

rule.name: ProjectFileNoFunctionsRule
rule.description: .dpr/.dpk files should not have procedures/functions.

rule.name: ProjectFileNoVariablesRule
rule.description: .dpr/.dpk files should not have variables.

rule.name: TypeAliasRule
rule.description: You should not use type aliases.

property.name: xpath
property.value: //TkNewType/*[count(descendant::*) < 3 and name(descendant::*) != 'class' and name(descendant::*) != 'TkRecord' and name(descendant::*) != 'array' and name(descendant::*) != 'set' and name(descendant::*) != 'dash_pointer' and name(descendant::*) != 'TkClassOfType' and name(descendant::*) != 'TkInterface' and name() != 'TkCustomAttribute']

rule.message: Keywords should comply with a naming convention.
rule.name: UppercaseReservedKeywordsRule
rule.description: Avoid using uppercase reserverd keywords.

rule.message: Avoid using mixed names for functions / variables.
rule.name: MixedNamesRule
rule.description: Avoid using uppercase reserverd keywords.

rule.name: UnusedUnitRule
rule.description: Unused unit. No other unit has this unit in it's uses section. Probably you could remove this unit from project.

rule.name: UnusedFunctionRule
rule.description: Unused function/procedure. No other unit uses this function/procedure in it's uses section. Probably you could remove it from project.

rule.name: ConstructorWithoutInheritedStatementRule
rule.description: Constructor without 'inherited' statement.

rule.name: DestructorWithoutInheritedStatementRule
rule.description: Destructor without 'inherited' statement.

rule.name: NoBeginAfterDoRule
rule.description: 'Begin' statement should be placed after 'do' statement to prevent errors.

rule.name: WithAfterDoThenRule
rule.description: 'with' statement used directly after 'do' or 'then' statements. You should place 'begin' directly after 'do' or 'then' statements.

rule.message: No semicolon at the end of code block.
rule.name: NoSemicolonRule
rule.description: No semicolon at the end of code block.

rule.name: CastAndFreeRule
rule.description: You should not cast an object before freeing it.

rule.message: Methods should not be too complex.
rule.name: MethodCyclomaticComplexityRule
rule.description: The cyclomatic complexity of methods should not exceed a defined threshold. Complex code can perform poorly and will in any case be difficult to understand and therefore to maintain.
